intro: Bidens clavata, commonly known as the slender ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and central United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its yellow flowers consist of ray florets and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Bidens clavata is often found in moist habitats such as wetlands, stream banks, and marshes.
